title: Fundamental Limits of Membership Inference Attacks on Machine Learning Models. (arXiv:2310.13786v1 [stat.ML])
abstract: Membership inference attacks (MIA) can reveal whether a particular data point was part of the training dataset, potentially exposing sensitive information about individuals. This article explores the fundamental statistical limitations associated with MIAs on machine learning models. More precisely, we first derive the statistical quantity that governs the effectiveness and success of such attacks. Then, we investigate several situations for which we provide bounds on this quantity of interest. This allows us to infer the accuracy of potential attacks as a function of the number of samples and other structural parameters of learning models, which in some cases can be directly estimated from the dataset.
context:
Title: Fundamental Limits of Membership Inference Attacks on Machine Learning Models. (arXiv:2310.13786v1 [stat.ML])
Abstract: Membership inference attacks (MIA) can reveal whether a particular data point was part of the training dataset, potentially exposing sensitive information about individuals. This article explores the fundamental statistical limitations associated with MIAs on machine learning models. More precisely, we first derive the statistical quantity that governs the effectiveness and success of such attacks. Then, we investigate several situations for which we provide bounds on this quantity of interest. This allows us to infer the accuracy of potential attacks as a function of the number of samples and other structural parameters of learning models, which in some cases can be directly estimated from the dataset.
translated_title: 机器学习模型的成员推断攻击的基本限制
translated_abstract: 成员推断攻击（MIA）可以揭示特定数据点是否是训练数据集的一部分，可能暴露个人的敏感信息。本文探讨了关于机器学习模型上MIA的基本统计限制。具体而言，我们首先推导了统计量，该统计量决定了这种攻击的有效性和成功率。然后，我们研究了几种情况，并对这个感兴趣的统计量提供了界限。这使我们能够根据样本数量和学习模型的其他结构参数推断潜在攻击的准确性，在某些情况下可以直接从数据集中估计。
tldr: 本文探讨了机器学习模型上成员推断攻击的基本限制，包括推导了效果和成功率的统计量，并提供了几种情况下的界限。这使得我们能够根据样本数量和其他结构参数推断潜在攻击的准确性。
en_tdlr: This article explores the fundamental limitations of membership inference attacks on machine learning models, including deriving statistical quantities that govern the effectiveness and success rate of such attacks and providing bounds in various scenarios. This allows for inferring the accuracy of potential attacks based on the number of samples and other structural parameters.
